tool.name: QIIME vizualisation extractor
tool.command:
unzip '$infile' "*/data/*" && mkdir -p '${viz.extra_files_path}' && mv '$infile.metadata.uuid'/data/* '${viz.extra_files_path}' &&
## the html file use <script src="./data.jsonp" charset="utf-8"></script> ## Galaxy sets application/octet-stream as mime type for which browsers ## refuse to include the file. Therefore we replace the extensions by js ## for which Galaxy sets the appropriate mime type for nonjs in \$(cat '${viz.extra_files_path}'/*.html | grep '<script src="' | sed 's/^\s*<script src="//; s/".*//' | grep -v "\.js\$"); do js=\$(echo "\$nonjs" | sed 's/\.[^.]\+$//').js && mv '${viz.extra_files_path}'"/\$nonjs" '${viz.extra_files_path}'"/\$js" && sed -i -e "s@\"\${nonjs}\"@\"\${js}\"@" '${viz.extra_files_path}'/*.html; done &&
mv '${viz.extra_files_path}'/index.html '$viz'
tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
The tool extracts visualisation from QIIME artivarct datasets (qza, qzv).
QIIME artifact files are zip files that contain visualisations of the data which is extracted by this tool.
Note that Galaxy contains a Display application that uses https://view.qiime2.org/ to show this data. For non-public Galaxy instances this does not work.
